intro: Cestichis forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' cestichis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
